de.polygonal.ds.pooling.LinkedObjectPool<T>

type
class
implements
de.polygonal.ds.Hashable

A dynamic object pool based on a doubly linked list.

See http://lab.polygonal.de/2008/06/18/using-object-pools/.

Constructor

new(x : Int, ?growable : Bool)

parameters
growable if true, new objects are allocated the first time an object is requested while the pool being empty.
Creates a LinkedObjectPool object capable of managing x pre-allocated objects.
Use allocate() to fill the pool.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

Instance Methods

allocate(?C : Class<T>, ?fabricate : Void -> T, ?factory : de.polygonal.ds.Factory<T>) : Void

parameters
C allocates objects by instantiating the class C.
fabricate allocates objects by calling fabricate().
factory allocates objects by calling factory.create().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError invalid arguments.
Allocates the pool.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all nodes, pointers and elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

inline get() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError object pool exhausted (debug only).
Retrieves the next available object from the pool.

inline getSize() : Int

The total number of pre-allocated objects in the pool.

inline getUsageCount() : Int

The number of used objects.

inline getWasteCount() : Int

The total number of unused thus wasted objects.
Use purge() to compact the pool.

purge() : Void

Removes all unused objects from the pool.
If the number of remaining used objects is smaller than the initial capacity defined in the constructor, new objects are created to refill the pool.

inline put(o : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError object pool is full (debug only).
Recycles the object o so it can be reused by calling get().

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Prints out all object if compiled with the -debug directive.
